```{python}
#| label: setup
#| include: false

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.patches import Rectangle


df = pd.read_csv('data/raw/raw.csv')

# 2. Set the "Blue/White" Minimalist Design System
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid", context="talk")
# Palette: 0 (Loser) = Soft Grey, 1 (Winner) = Professional Blue
custom_palette = {0: '#bdc3c7', 1: '#005b96'} 

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (10, 6)
plt.rcParams['font.family'] = 'sans-serif'

```

## The Disconnect
```{python}
#| label: fig-disconnect
#| fig-cap: ""

if not df.empty:
    plt.figure(figsize=(11, 6))
    
    # Scatter Plot: Metascore vs User Score
    sns.scatterplot(
        data=df, 
        x='Metascore', 
        y='Userscore', 
        hue='Winner', 
        style='Winner', 
        palette=custom_palette, 
        s=250, 
        alpha=0.9,
        legend=False
    )
    
    # Reference Line: Perfect Agreement (Scaled: 100 Meta = 10 User)
    plt.plot([60, 100], [6, 10], '--', color='grey', alpha=0.5)

    # Annotation for "The Gap"

    plt.title('Critic Score vs. Player Score', fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Critic Metascore (Media)')
    plt.ylabel('User Score (Players)')
    
    sns.despine(left=True)
    plt.show()

```



## The "Sweet Spot"

```{python}
#| label: fig-sweet-spot
#| fig-cap: ""
if not df.empty:
    plt.figure(figsize=(11, 6))

    sns.scatterplot(
        data=df, 
        x='Gameplay_Score', 
        y='Artistry_Score', 
        hue='Winner', 
        palette=custom_palette,
        s=300, 
        alpha=0.9,
        legend=False
    )
    
    target_rect = Rectangle((7.5, 8.5), 2.5, 1.5, linewidth=2.5, edgecolor='crimson', facecolor='none', linestyle='--')
    plt.gca().add_patch(target_rect)
    
    plt.text(7.6, 9.6, "THE WINNING ZONE", color='crimson', fontsize=12, fontweight='bold')
    plt.text(7.6, 9.4, "(High Art + Solid Play)", color='crimson', fontsize=10)

    plt.title('Gameplay vs. Artistry', fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=15)
    plt.xlabel('Gameplay Score (Fun Factor)')
    plt.ylabel('Artistry Score (Narrative/Visuals)')
    
    plt.legend(title='Winner', loc='lower left', frameon=True)

    sns.despine()
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

```



## The Strategic Drivers

```{python}
#| label: fig-drivers
#| fig-cap: ""

if not df.empty:
    # Calculate Correlation with Real Data
    # We want to see what correlates with 'Winner' (Awards) vs 'Userscore' (Players)
    metrics = ['Artistry_Score', 'Gameplay_Score']
    targets = ['Winner', 'Userscore']
    
    # Compute correlation matrix
    corr_matrix = df[metrics + targets].corr()
    
    # Prepare data for plotting
    plot_data = pd.DataFrame({
        'Feature': ['Artistry', 'Artistry', 'Gameplay', 'Gameplay'],
        'Success Metric': ['Awards (Winner)', 'Player Love (UserScore)', 'Awards (Winner)', 'Player Love (UserScore)'],
        'Correlation': [
            corr_matrix.loc['Artistry_Score', 'Winner'],
            corr_matrix.loc['Artistry_Score', 'Userscore'],
            corr_matrix.loc['Gameplay_Score', 'Winner'],
            corr_matrix.loc['Gameplay_Score', 'Userscore']
        ]
    })

    plt.figure(figsize=(11, 6))
    
    # Bar Chart
    sns.barplot(
        data=plot_data,
        x='Feature',
        y='Correlation',
        hue='Success Metric',
        palette={'Awards (Winner)': '#005b96', 'Player Love (UserScore)': '#2ecc71'}
    )

    plt.title('What Drives Success? Awards vs. Players', fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Game Feature')
    plt.ylabel('Impact (Correlation Coefficient)')
    plt.axhline(0, color='black', linewidth=0.8)
    
    sns.despine(left=True)
    plt.show()

```


## Indie or AAA?

```{python}
#| label: fig-budget-bias
#| fig-cap: "Insight 4: The 'Indie Tax' - Indies need higher scores to compete."

if not df.empty:
    # Set up a FacetGrid to compare AAA vs Indie/Other side-by-side
    g = sns.FacetGrid(
        df, 
        col="Production_Type", 
        col_order=["AAA", "Indie"], # Focus on these two main categories
        hue="Winner",
        palette=custom_palette,
        height=5, 
        aspect=1
    )

    # Map the scatter plot onto the grid
    g.map(sns.scatterplot, "Gameplay_Score", "Artistry_Score", s=250, alpha=0.9)

    # Add the "Winning Threshold" line (e.g., Artistry = 9.0) to both plots for comparison
    g.refline(y=9.0, color='crimson', linestyle='--', linewidth=1.5)

    # Custom Titles and Labels
    g.set_titles(col_template="{col_name} Games", size=14, fontweight='bold')
    g.set_axis_labels("Gameplay Score", "Artistry Score")
    
    # Adjust the legend
    g.add_legend(title="Winner", bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 0.5), loc='center left')

    # Add annotation to highlight the difference
    # Note: These coordinates might need slight adjustment based on exact data points
    plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.85)
    g.fig.suptitle("The 'Budget Bias': Do Indies need to work harder?", fontsize=16, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.show()

```
